result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money and prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
State to advise if $485 seized from defendant at time of arrest can be applied to costs due.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any sentence defendant is currently serving.

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form
Defendant

Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State. Def appears in custody and by video conference from Dodge Correctional Institution & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich. Agreement reached. Def waives preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver. State to file Information with amended charge within 48 hrs. Count #1 amended on State's motion to possess cocaine with intent to deliver between 1 & 5 grams, per Sec. 961.41(1m)(cm)1r, Wis. Stats. Def pleads guilty to amended offense, is convicted and sentenced. Counts #2 and #3 are dismissed and read in. Def requesting that the $485 cash seized at time of arrest be applied toward costs due in this case. State to notify the parties and court whether that money can be applied or not. If no, a hearing can be scheduled on defendant's request for return of seized property.
